content: in this legal case in estonia the harju county court made a final decision after a 2year and 7month process the details of the case are not mentioned but one party is responsible for covering the procedural costs the claimant who is the husband is making a statement and submitting a claim related to the death of the defendants mother an inheritance certificate has been drawn up stating that the claimant and the defendant have equal shares of the assets the claimant wants to terminate the joint ownership and division of the assets both parties have incurred expenses related to the upkeep of a property the claimant accuses the defendant of transferring money to thirdparty accounts without their knowledge the defendant has compensated the claimant for funeral expenses the court determines that the claimant should keep the apartment properties in tallinn and the defendant should keep the property in harjumaa the court also orders the claimant to compensate the defendant for the difference in the value of the remaining property the court considers evidence of embezzlement by the defendant both parties submitted statements and invoices related to the assets the court orders the claimant to be compensated for expenses related to the inherited property the court makes decisions regarding the transfer of real estate and ownership entries the parties have the option to reach a compromise before the decision becomes final the court may cancel the decision if there is an appeal or a compromise the allocation of procedural costs will be determined if there is an appeal
